title: Belkin gets the CES 2025 party started with a ton of accessories - XDA Developers
summary:
Belkin gets the CES 2025 party started with a ton of accessories

Publication Date: January 5, 2024 Source: XDA

As CES 2025 approaches, Belkin has revealed a variety of new accessories including charging pads, audio devices, and tools for content creation. The excitement builds as tech enthusiasts look forward to the events starting on January 7, 2024.

  • Belkin is showcasing accessories in three categories: charging, audio, and content creation.
  • The BoostCharge Pro Magnetic Wireless Charging Pad offers 15W fast charging.
  • New headphones include the SoundForm Anywhere and SoundForm Isolate, with the former designed for both indoor and outdoor use.
  • Belkin aims to deliver several products by mid-2025, including power banks and a Creator Bundle.
“This year, Belkin is taking three accessory categories to the stage: charging, audio, and content creation.”

The upcoming CES will provide a platform for Belkin to exhibit its latest innovations, gathering attention from both consumers and industry professionals alike.
newTitle: Belkin Unveils Accessories Ahead of CES 2025

title: Roborock's New Robot Vac Has an Arm to Pick Up Dirty Socks and Underwear - CNET
summary:
Roborock's New Robot Vac Has an Arm to Pick Up Dirty Socks and Underwear

Publication Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: CNET

Roborock has introduced its latest robot vacuum, the Saros Z70, which boasts a unique mechanical arm capable of picking up small items while cleaning.

  • The Saros Z70 features the OmniGrip, a five-axis robotic arm that can lift objects up to 10.5 ounces.
  • The vacuum also has advanced navigation with next-gen sensors and AI-powered object recognition.
  • Initial demos showed some mechanical glitches, but Roborock assures that these issues have been addressed for retail versions.
  • The vacuum can detect and avoid up to 108 different obstacles during cleaning cycles.
  • Safety features include a child lock and a safety stop button to prevent accidental grabs.
"Instead of using a traditional LDS (LIDAR) tower module for navigation, the system integrates next-gen dual-light 3D time-of-flight sensors and RGB cameras powered by AI to determine its position, surroundings and whether the object it grips is overweight." - Roborock

The Roborock Saros Z70 not only innovates with its mechanical arm but also maintains strong vacuuming capabilities with 22,000 Pa of suction power and an anti-tangle system.
newTitle: Roborock Unveils Innovative Robot Vacuum with Grabbing Arm

title: Nvidia’s RTX 5090 leaks with 32GB of GDDR7 memory - The Verge
summary:
Nvidia’s RTX 5090 leaks with 32GB of GDDR7 memory

Publication Date: Today | Source: VideoCardz

Nvidia’s unreleased RTX 5090 has surfaced with a marketing image that verifies the presence of 32GB of GDDR7 memory. The packaging reveals a 3.5-slot cooler design.

  • The RTX 5090 is expected to have double the memory of the RTX 5080.
  • It could feature 21,760 CUDA cores and a memory bandwidth of nearly 1.8TB/s.
  • The TDP is rumored to be 575 watts, exceeding the RTX 4090 by 125 watts.
  • An official announcement is anticipated during Nvidia's CES keynote.
“The RTX 5080 could debut first on January 21st, followed by Nvidia’s other RTX 50-series cards.”

The RTX 5090's release is on the horizon, with significant enhancements that promise to redefine GPU performance.
newTitle: Nvidia’s RTX 5090 Leaks: Features 32GB of GDDR7 Memory

title: Exclusive: First look at GeForce RTX 5090 with 32GB GDDR7 memory - VideoCardz.com
Samsung’s new QD-OLED TV panel can reach 4,000 nits brightness - SamMobile - Samsung news
summary:
Samsung Unveils QD-OLED TV Panel with 4,000 Nits Brightness

Date: January 5, 2025

Source: SamMobile

Samsung Display has introduced its new generation QD-OLED panel that can achieve peak brightness of over 4,000 nits, showcasing its innovations at CES 2025.

  • The new fourth-generation QD-OLED panel is 30% brighter than last year’s model, which had a maximum brightness of 3,000 nits.
  • It utilizes advanced panel driving technology and new organic materials to reach this brightness.
  • Samsung will showcase a 77-inch prototype TV at CES 2025, along with a media art installation called ‘QD Jungle’ that immerses visitors in a forest-like experience.
  • Samsung may or may not fully utilize the panel's capabilities in its upcoming OLED TVs.
  • The new QD-OLED monitor panels are aimed at content creation and gaming, available in various sizes.
“Using red, green, and blue sub-pixels ensures the highest color purity compared to competitors.”

Samsung's advancements in QD-OLED technology signify an impressive leap in display capabilities, setting new benchmarks for brightness and color purity in the television industry.
newTitle: Samsung Unveils QD-OLED TV Panel with 4,000 Nits Brightness

Squid Game's premium Finishing Move is broken in Black Ops 6 and Warzone - Sportskeeda
summary:
Squid Game's Premium Finishing Move is broken in Black Ops 6 and Warzone

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Sportskeeda

The new Finishing Move, included with the Squid Game Premium Event Pass in Black Ops 6 and Warzone, is broken. The finisher, called 'Roped In,' fails to eliminate enemies despite the animation playing correctly.

  • The Roped In Finishing Move animation plays out as intended but does not eliminate opponents.
  • This issue persists in both Black Ops 6 and Warzone.
  • Players are frustrated as the game developers have not yet acknowledged the bug.
  • It costs players 1100 CP ($10) to access the Premium Event Pass to unlock this move.
"Its failure to work correctly has upset several people, especially those who paid for the Premium Pass."

In conclusion, the glitch in the Roped In Finishing Move raises concerns among players, particularly those who have invested money into the event pass.
newTitle: Squid Game's Finishing Move is Bugged in Black Ops 6 and Warzone

iPhone SE 4 might be called iPhone 16E, to launch globally in the first half of 2025 - Kalinga TV
summary:
iPhone SE 4 might be called iPhone 16E, to launch globally in the first half of 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Apple will be introducing its new iPhone, possibly named the iPhone 16E, in the first half of 2025. The device is rumored to launch by early April 2025, featuring significant upgrades over the previous models.

  • The upcoming iPhone is suggested to be called the iPhone 16E instead of the iPhone SE 4.
  • It will feature a larger 6.06-inch OLED display, a significant upgrade from the SE 3's 4.7-inch LCD.
  • Other upgrades include a Touch ID home button, an A18 chipset with 8GB of RAM, and a 48MP rear camera.
  • Pricing is expected to start around $500 in the US and between Rs 49,000 to Rs 54,000 in India.
“Most the information is based on leaks/rumours, more details will likely be teased soon.”

This anticipated launch is expected to bring notable enhancements to the SE series, making it more comparable to the latest iPhone 16 series.
newTitle: iPhone SE 4 may be renamed iPhone 16E, set for global launch in early 2025

GTA 6 set to break all records? Top market analyst firm predicts sales of Rockstar Games to reach $3 billion - Indiatimes.com
summary:
GTA 6 Expected to Set Sales Records with Projections of $3 Billion

Publication Date: 2025 Source: ESPN

GTA 6, one of the most anticipated games, is predicted by market research firm DFC Intelligence to generate over $3 billion in sales within its first year.

  • DFC Intelligence forecasts GTA 6 will achieve milestone sales similar to GTA 5.
  • Initial sales are expected to surpass $1 billion through pre-orders alone.
  • The estimated total sales for the first year, ending in November 2026, is projected to be $2.2 billion.
“GTA 5's success across the last decade will lead to stronger initial sales when Rockstar finally launches GTA 6,” said DFC founder David Cole.

In conclusion, with a robust sales forecast and a strong legacy from its predecessor, GTA 6 is set to break the gaming industry's sales records.
newTitle: GTA 6 Expected to Set Sales Records with Projections of $3 Billion

summary:
Mercedes-AMG CLE 53 Coupe Set for 2025 India Launch: Design, Features, and Performance

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Wion

The Mercedes-AMG CLE 53 Coupe, which was unveiled globally in December 2023, will make its Indian debut in 2025, featuring design updates and enhanced performance.

  • The car features a stylish new front design with a Panamericana grille and sleeker LED headlights.
  • Rear design changes include two-part LED taillights and a quad exhaust system.
  • Dimensions have increased, with a wider stance and larger optional wheels.
  • Interior tech includes a 12.3-inch driver display and an 11.9-inch MBUX touchscreen.
  • Performance powered by a 3.0-litre twin-turbocharged six-cylinder engine with a 48V mild-hybrid system.
  • Equipped with rear-wheel steering for improved handling.
“The coupe delivers a combined output of 443 bhp and 560 Nm of peak torque.”

Overall, the Mercedes-AMG CLE 53 Coupe promises to be a significant addition to the performance car market in India.
newTitle: Mercedes-AMG CLE 53 Coupe Set for 2025 India Launch: Design, Features, and Performance

summary:
Samsung One UI 7 Stable Update: Everything You Need to Know

Date: December 2024
Source: Sammy Fans

Samsung has announced the One UI 7, which is currently in the beta testing phase for the Galaxy S24 series. The stable update is anticipated to roll out in early 2025, promising a redesigned UI and enhanced features.

  • One UI 7 is based on Android 15 and is being beta tested.
  • The stable release is expected in the first quarter of 2025, likely in February.
  • Key features include a redesigned UI, AI enhancements, and improved security measures.
  • Eligible devices range from Galaxy S, Z, A, M, and F series to Galaxy Tabs.
"The One UI 7 beta version gives us a taste of what’s to come, but it is the stable update that will really prove if Samsung can make good on its promises for a more personalized, secure, and smooth user experience." - Robin, Tech Writer

Stay tuned for more updates and prepare for new features and improvements with One UI 7.

title: iPhone 17 Air May Cost Around Rs 90000 In India, What To Expect From Apple This Year - Times Now
iPhone SE 4 Price Leaks Ahead Of Rumoured Launch This Year: Here’s What To Expect - Times Now
summary:
iPhone SE 4 Price Leaks Ahead Of Rumoured Launch This Year: Here’s What To Expect

Published on: Not provided

Source: Not provided

Apple is reportedly gearing up to launch its next-generation iPhone SE 4, expected early this year. While the company hasn’t officially announced details, a wave of leaks and rumours has given Apple fans plenty to discuss.

  • The iPhone SE 4 is expected to come with a higher price tag compared to its predecessor.
  • A recent report suggests a price of over KRW 8,00,000 (around Rs 46,700) globally, likely under $500.
  • The design may resemble the iPhone 14, with a larger 6.1-inch OLED display and Face ID.
  • It is rumoured to feature Apple’s A18 chip, 8GB of RAM, and a 48MP camera.
  • The inclusion of a USB-C charging port and 5G connectivity with Apple's in-house modem is also expected.
  • In India, the price could approach Rs 49,900.
“Only time will tell if these upgrades are worth it in terms of the price hike when the device is finally released.”

The iPhone SE 4 promises significant enhancements, but a price increase raises questions on its affordability and value for budget-conscious consumers.
newTitle: iPhone SE 4 Price Leaks Ahead Of Rumoured Launch This Year: Here’s What To Expect
